p: The currently assigned heterogeneous species aggregates P. sp. aff. ovalifolia and P. sp. aff. rotundifolia are not segregated according to their phytochemistry. Rather, individual taxa are demonstrated to generally stand-alone according to individual essential oil chemical profiles. For example, Z-dihydroagarofuran is expressed in P. lanceolata (LAA: affiliated with P. ovalifolia) and in P. sp. Blue Mountains (BEM: affiliated with P. rotundifolia). However, both are segregated by multivariate analysis ( Figure 3), except for the one specimen LAA-1 that expressed a low amount of p-cymene ( Table 1). Nevertheless, by far the prevailing chemical phenotypes do not overlap.
